collection.description: This collection consists of documents including indentures, deeds, leases, omnibuses, wills, a few court rolls, conveyances, and other legal documents from the fourteenth century through the early twentieth century. Most of them have small wax seals and a few also have large royal seals, some of which are intact in their original metal canisters.
collection.title: Wakefield Vellum Documents

item.terms_of_use: The images on this web site are from material in the collections of the Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections of Northwestern University Libraries, and are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. provenance.item: This collection of vellum documents was purchased from William C. Wakefield by Northwestern University in 1959.

item.label: George III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820
item.label_with_role: George III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820 (Topical)

variants.item: Georg III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820

item.title: Lease for one year of property in the West Indies, including enslaved persons, from Hungerford Spooner and Sir Cecil Wray to Thomas Norton. Consideration money and an annual rent of one peppercorn. References the islands of Saint Christopher (St. Kitts), Jamaica, Grenada. Signed and sealed by Spooner and Wray. George III
item.library_unit: Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections

item.label: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines--Saint Vincent
item.label_with_role: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines--Saint Vincent (Geographical)

item.label: George III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820
item.label_with_role: George III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820 (Topical)

variants.item: Georg III, King of Great Britain, 1738-1820

item.title: West Indies, Island of St. Vincent. 3 skins of parchment, being a schedule of enslaved persons in an indenture, being a marriage settlement between Sir William Young, and his intended second wife Barbara Talbot. George, Marquis of Buckingham and Jacob, Earl of Radnor are named as trustees for the settlement, with Duncan Campbell and James Hartley appointed as attorneys. The list of 227 enslaved persons is subdivided by gender and age. ref: George III
item.library_unit: Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections

project.name: Slavery, Enslaved Persons, and Free Blacks in the Americas Collection / Frederick Douglas Collection / Wakefield Vellum Documents

provenance.item: This collection of vellum documents was purchased from William C. Wakefield by Northwestern University in 1959.

item.title: 5 skins, incomplete. Indenture regarding the ownership through various trusts of a plantation in the West Indies, including enslaved persons, tenements, messages, plantation utensils, storehouses, cattle, horses, etc. References the islands of Saint Christopher (St. Kitts) and Grenada. A payment of 60,000 pounds was made at some time. Interested parties include: Sir Cecil Wray, William Manning, Samuel Bosanquet. Previous indentures quoted
item.library_unit: Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections

item.label: George II, King of Great Britain, 1683-1760
item.label_with_role: George II, King of Great Britain, 1683-1760 (Topical)

item.title: Document of parchment, 5 skins, incomplete, first and last sheets missing. The indenture deals with the ownership of plantations, enslaved persons, and similar West Indies properties. Family name is Duport. Assignment Mrs. Harris to John Spooner; her maiden name may have been Duport. References island of St. Christopher (St. Kitts). George II
item.library_unit: Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections

physical_description_material.item: 5 skins, incomplete, first and last sheets missing.
